briefTitle: Use of an Oral Beta-2 Agonist in Persons With Spinal Cord Injury

armGroups.label: Arm 2
interventionNames: Drug: extended release beta-2 adrenergic agonist

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Chronic Spinal Cord Injury (\>1 year post-injury)
* All American Spinal Injury Association (ASIA) classifications
* High Paraplegia (level of injury T1-T6)
* Tetraplegia (level of injury C2-C8, non-ventilator dependent)

Exclusion Criteria:

* history of asthma
* uncontrolled hypertension or cardiovascular disease
* those using beta-2 adrenergic agonists
* epilepsy or seizure disorder
* hyperthyroidism
* chronic corticosteroid use
* those taking monoamine oxidase inhibitors or Tricyclic antidepressants for depression
* hypersensitivity to albuterol or any of its' delete components
* pregnancy
* use of ergogenic aids or supplements with anabolic characteristics including, but not limited to:

  * creatine monohydrate
  * anabolic steroids (e.g., testosterone)
  * growth hormone and their analogs and/or derivatives

outcomeMeasures.title: Inspiratory Respiratory Muscle Strength
outcomeMeasures.description: Respiratory muscle strength as measured by maximal inspiratory and pressures at the mouth.

outcomeMeasures.title: Expiratory Respiratory Muscle Strength
outcomeMeasures.description: Respiratory Muscle Strength defines as Maximal expiratory muscle strength at the mouth.
